bug.short_desc: after selecting an alternate Kickoff menu, its icon changes from Fedora icon to KDE icon

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: Kickoff menu icon is the Fedora icon. When you rightclick on it and select another alternative, the icon changes from Fedora icon to KDE icon. Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): Kf 5.12

Probably nothing to be done about this. The initial/default icon branding is implemented via a plasma javascript snippet that runs once during initial login. Once you change or customize that initial setup, the branding gets lost.

Sorry, but I don't think CANTFIX makes sense as a resolution here. That is only for things that are truly impossible to fix, e.g. for legal reasons, or because it would require changing already released packages (e.g. %postun scriptlet breakage). In this case, there ought to be a way to make this work. The code that changes the menu probably needs to transfer the setting for the menu icon. (Isn't that how this worked in Plasma 4?)
plasma4 had the same problem OK, s/CANTFIX/WONTFIX/ , I personally don't think it's worth the time/effort to handle the case described
> plasma4 had the same problem Not true, I just tested it on my notebook's F21 installation, switching back and forth doesn't change the icon, it stays the Fedora one.
OK, I guess I was thinking of the case of adding widgets (or new panels), not changing existing ones.

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug. If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug. Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
fwiw, this was fixed properly in f24 (using new per-widget scripting features)
